title: Impossible to use GPU A100 on cluster.
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

Impossible to run GPU for analysis via cluster. 

I'm trying to run video analysis on remote GPU (Nvidia A100, via a cluster).

I tried different combinations of python, tf, CUDA versions to match with https://www.tensorflow.org/install/source#gpu but I always fail to use my remote GPU. The only thing I managed to do is runing analysis without GPU. 

Regarding GPU, I deal with "cannot dlopen library" issues. 

Could you please indicate which dependencies (and enventually which specific versions) should I put into my yaml file? 

Thank you, 
Best,


### Operating System

gcc 4.8.5 - Red Hat 4.8.5-44 / Centos 7
Cuda 10.2

### DeepLabCut version

DLC version: 2.2.0.1

### DeepLabCut mode

multi animal

### Device type

A100

### Steps To Reproduce

My environment (miniconda) contains:

Python 3.8
cudnn 7.6.5.32
tensorflow 2.2
cudatoolkit 10.2.89

Command to submit to cluster:

### Relevant log output

### Anything else?

I tried the conda installation with different versions of python (3.7 to 3.9) and tensorflow (2.0 to 2.6) but in neither of the cases the conda environment was functional for GPU computing or, in some cases, it wasn't possible to create the environment due to package conflicts.

### Code of Conduct
